New Records: Francisco Lindor hit a grand slam, sending the New York Mets to the NLCS for the first time in nine years.
The Mets are headed back to the National League Championship Series for the first time since 2009.
Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor's sixth-inning grand slam sent Citi Field into pandemonium, clinching the Mets' first postseason series at the ballpark since 2009.
The Mets topped the Phillies 4-1, forcing a decisive Game 5 in the Dodgers-Padres series.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets await the winner of the Los Angeles Dodgersâ€“San Diego Padres series, which will go to a decisive Game 5 after an 8-0 Dodgers rout.
The Yankees and Tigers took the lead in their series, with the Tigers inching closer to the ALCS.
Post-Match Reflections: The Mets celebrated their breakthrough, with the longest-tenured players calling it a 'dream come true.'
The Phillies season with high hopes ended too soon, with the team facing the hurt of another early exit.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the first postseason series at Citi Field since it opened in 2009.
The Tigers brought playoff baseball back in full force, with the team's pitching staff showing a level of success in the postseason.
Others: The Padres will turn to Yu Darvish for Game 5, while the Dodgers will face the winner of the Padres-Dodgers series.
The Yankees will look to close out the series against the Royals, with Gerrit Cole set to start for New York.
